newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft trades lower after hours.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft trades lower after hours.

text.p: Microsoft Corp fell back to 85-1/2 after trading as high as 89 in an active after-hours session following the release of its quarterly earnings, traders said on Friday.
The stock closed at 87-1/8 on the NASDAQ National Market earlier.
The company reported second-quarter earnings of $0.57 a share against $0.45 a year ago.
The First Call consensus estimate was for earnings of $0.51 a share.
The company's chief financial officer, Mike Brown, said he expected earnings and revenues to rise sequentially in the fiscal third and fourth quarters against the just-ended second quarter.
